sentence: What did the ocean say to the river? you can run but you cant tide.
explanation: The word tide can refer to the rise and fall of sea levels caused by the gravitational forces exerted by the moon and sun. It can also refer to the general trend or movement of a situation.
first_new_sentence: The tide rises in the morning as the moon approaches.
second_new_sentence: The tide of public opinion shifted dramatically after the new report was released.

sentence: I can always count on the local cemetery for free mothers day flowers.
explanation: The word count can mean to determine the total number of something by putting them in order. It can also mean to have significance or be considered important.
first_new_sentence: You need to count the number of chairs before the event starts.
second_new_sentence: Your opinion does count in this discussion.

sentence: Whats the difference between three dicks and a joke? your momma cant take a joke.
explanation: The word joke can refer to a humorous story or anecdote. It can also refer to something absurd or ridiculous.
first_new_sentence: He told a hilarious joke at the party last night.
second_new_sentence: It was a joke that he thought he could fix the situation with no resources.
